verses.verse: Behold, a <S%H4428>king<s%> shall <S%H4427>reign<s%> in <S%H6664>righteousness<s%>, and <S%H8269>princes<s%> shall <S%H8323>rule<s%> in <S%H4941>judgment<s%>.

And a <S%H376>man<s%> shall be as an hiding <S%H4224>place<s%> from the <S%H7307>wind<s%>, and a <S%H5643>covert<s%> from the <S%H2230>tempest<s%>; as <S%H6388>rivers<s%> of <S%H4325>water<s%> in a dry <S%H6724>place<s%>, as the <S%H6738>shadow<s%> of a <S%H3515>great<s%> <S%H5553>rock<s%> in a <S%H5889>weary<s%> <S%H776>land<s%>. great: Heb. heavy
And the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> of them that <S%H7200>see<s%> shall not be <S%H8159>dim<s%>, and the <S%H241>ears<s%> of them that <S%H8085>hear<s%> shall <S%H7181>hearken<s%>.

The <S%H3824>heart<s%> also of the <S%H4116>rash<s%> shall <S%H995>understand<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>, and the <S%H3956>tongue<s%> of the <S%H5926>stammerers<s%> shall be <S%H4116>ready<s%> to <S%H1696>speak<s%> <S%H6703>plainly<s%>. rash: Heb. hasty plainly: or, elegantly
The vile <S%H5036>person<s%> shall be no more <S%H7121>called<s%> <S%H5081>liberal<s%>, nor the <S%H3596>churl<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> to be <S%H7771>bountiful<s%>.

For the vile <S%H5036>person<s%> will <S%H1696>speak<s%> <S%H5039>villany<s%>, and his <S%H3820>heart<s%> will <S%H6213>work<s%> <S%H205>iniquity<s%>, to <S%H6213>practise<s%> <S%H2612>hypocrisy<s%>, and to <S%H1696>utter<s%> <S%H8442>error<s%> against the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, to make <S%H7324>empty<s%> the <S%H5315>soul<s%> of the <S%H7457>hungry<s%>, and he will cause the <S%H4945>drink<s%> of the <S%H6771>thirsty<s%> to <S%H2637>fail<s%>.

The <S%H3627>instruments<s%> also of the <S%H3596>churl<s%> are <S%H7451>evil<s%>: he <S%H3289>deviseth<s%> wicked <S%H2154>devices<s%> to <S%H2254>destroy<s%> the <S%H6041>poor<s%> <S%H6035><s%> with <S%H8267>lying<s%> <S%H561>words<s%>, even when the <S%H34>needy<s%> <S%H1696>speaketh<s%> <S%H4941>right<s%>. the needy: or, he speaketh against the poor in judgment
But the <S%H5081>liberal<s%> <S%H3289>deviseth<s%> liberal <S%H5081>things<s%>; and by liberal <S%H5081>things<s%> shall he <S%H6965>stand<s%>. stand: or, be established

Rise <S%H6965>up<s%>, ye <S%H802>women<s%> that are at <S%H7600>ease<s%>; <S%H8085>hear<s%> my <S%H6963>voice<s%>, ye <S%H982>careless<s%> <S%H1323>daughters<s%>; give <S%H238>ear<s%> unto my <S%H565>speech<s%>.

Many <S%H3117>days<s%> and <S%H8141>years<s%> shall ye be <S%H7264>troubled<s%>, ye careless <S%H982>women<s%>: for the <S%H1210>vintage<s%> shall <S%H3615>fail<s%>, the <S%H625>gathering<s%> shall not <S%H935>come<s%>. Many: Heb. Days above a year

<S%H2729>Tremble<s%>, ye women that are at <S%H7600>ease<s%>; be <S%H7264>troubled<s%>, ye careless <S%H982>ones<s%>: <S%H6584>strip<s%> you, and make you <S%H6209>bare<s%>, and <S%H2290>gird<s%> sackcloth upon your <S%H2504>loins<s%>.
They shall <S%H5594>lament<s%> for the <S%H7699>teats<s%>, for the <S%H2531>pleasant<s%> <S%H7704>fields<s%>, for the <S%H6509>fruitful<s%> <S%H1612>vine<s%>. pleasant: Heb. fields of desire

Upon the <S%H127>land<s%> of my <S%H5971>people<s%> shall come <S%H5927>up<s%> <S%H6975>thorns<s%> and <S%H8068>briers<s%>; yea, upon all the <S%H1004>houses<s%> of <S%H4885>joy<s%> in the <S%H5947>joyous<s%> <S%H7151>city<s%>: yea: or, burning upon

Because the <S%H759>palaces<s%> shall be <S%H5203>forsaken<s%>; the <S%H1995>multitude<s%> of the <S%H5892>city<s%> shall be <S%H5800>left<s%>; the <S%H6076>forts<s%> and <S%H975>towers<s%> shall be for <S%H4631>dens<s%> <S%H5704>for<s%> <S%H5769>ever<s%>, a <S%H4885>joy<s%> of wild <S%H6501>asses<s%>, a <S%H4829>pasture<s%> of <S%H5739>flocks<s%>; forts: or, clifts and watchtowers

Until the <S%H7307>spirit<s%> be <S%H6168>poured<s%> upon us from on <S%H4791>high<s%>, and the <S%H4057>wilderness<s%> be a fruitful <S%H3759>field<s%>, and the fruitful <S%H3759>field<s%> be <S%H2803>counted<s%> for a <S%H3293>forest<s%>.
Then <S%H4941>judgment<s%> shall <S%H7931>dwell<s%> in the <S%H4057>wilderness<s%>, and <S%H6666>righteousness<s%> <S%H3427>remain<s%> in the fruitful <S%H3759>field<s%>.

And the <S%H4639>work<s%> of <S%H6666>righteousness<s%> shall be <S%H7965>peace<s%>; and the <S%H5656>effect<s%> of <S%H6666>righteousness<s%> <S%H8252>quietness<s%> and <S%H983>assurance<s%> <S%H5704>for<s%> <S%H5769>ever<s%>.

And my <S%H5971>people<s%> shall <S%H3427>dwell<s%> in a <S%H7965>peaceable<s%> <S%H5116>habitation<s%>, and in <S%H4009>sure<s%> <S%H4908>dwellings<s%>, and in <S%H7600>quiet<s%> resting <S%H4496>places<s%>;
When it shall <S%H1258>hail<s%>, coming <S%H3381>down<s%> on the <S%H3293>forest<s%>; and the <S%H5892>city<s%> shall be <S%H8213>low<s%> in a low <S%H8218>place<s%>. low in: or, utterly abased
<S%H835>Blessed<s%> are ye that <S%H2232>sow<s%> beside all <S%H4325>waters<s%>, that send <S%H7971>forth<s%> thither the <S%H7272>feet<s%> of the <S%H7794>ox<s%> and the <S%H2543>ass<s%>.
